Cinderbrew Meadery Guide

11.1 - Undermine(d)

Last Updated:February 25, 2025|Changelog

Welcome to the Cinderbrew Meadery Mythic+ guide for the World of Warcraft patch 11.1! This guide covers everything you need to know about your upcoming dungeon runs!

Route

Patch 11.1 - Undermine(d)
Cinderbrew Meadery

It is recommended to use the Mythic Dungeon Tools addon to look at your route and mobcount before the Mythic+ dungeon starts. Below you can see an example of a Weekly Route meant for +10 keys or lower. High Key Route will be added later into the season!

Simply import the route into the Mythic Dungeon Tool addon and take a look at it with your group.

Weekly Route

Pug Hard
Uility neededMedium

Utility Needs

Patch 11.1 - Undermine(d)
Cinderbrew Meadery
Enrage
Bleed
Magic Dispel
Magic Purge
  • ‍Thirsty
    • An Enrage buff that multiple mobs in this dungeon can gain. Especially scary on the casters or tank adds.
  • ‍Spill Drink
    • An Enrage buff that increases damage done by a Taste Tester which makes missing a kick on this mob way more dangerous.
  • ‍Bee-stial Wrath
    • An Enrage buff that increases damage done by a Bee Wrangler and nearby bees. Might be scary in combination with many
      ‍Shredding Sting       Bleeds from bees.
      • Interruptible.
  • Common utility examples:
    • ‍Hunter
      • ‍Tranquilizing Shot
    • ‍Rogue
      • ‍Shiv
    • ‍Druid
      • ‍Soothe
    • ‍Evoker
      • ‍Oppressing Roar         with
        ‍Overawe
    • ‍Monk
      • ‍Paralysis         with
        ‍Pressure Points
  • ‍Mean Mug
    • A stacking Bleed debuff on a tank that can lead to some issues if not controlled properly.
  • ‍Shredding Sting
    • A stacking Bleed debuff, can be dangerous if a single player gets multiple of those.
  • Common utility examples:
    • ‍Evoker
      • ‍Cauterizing Flame
    • ‍Paladin
      • ‍Blessing of Protection
  • ‍Erupting Inferno
    • A hard hitting Magic DoT that in combination with any other incoming damage may easily lead to death.
      • Interruptible.
  • ‍Burning Fermentation
    • Fire Magic DoT during the I'pa boss encounter. Can be useful to have a second dispel due to it being applied to two players at the same time.
  • Common utility examples:
    • ‍Priest
      • ‍Mass Dispel
    • ‍Warlock
      • ‍Singe Magic
  • ‍Rejuvenating Honey
    • A Magic buff that heals over 18 seconds.
      • Interruptible
  • Common utility examples:
    • ‍Warlock
      • ‍Devour Magic
    • ‍Hunter
      • ‍Tranquilizing Shot
    • ‍Priest
      • ‍Dispel Magic         and
        ‍Mass Dispel
    • ‍Shaman
      • ‍Purge
    • ‍Mage
      • ‍Spellsteal
    • ‍Demon Hunter
      • ‍Consume Magic

Brew Master Aldryr Trash Area

Patch 11.1 - Undermine(d)
Cinderbrew Meadery
Chef Chewie
Venture Co. Pyromaniac
Venture Co. Patron
Hired Muscle
Tasting Room Attendant
  • ‍Compliments of the Chef
    • An aura that increases damage done of nearby allies and makes them immune to crowd control.
  • ‍Tenderize
    • An AoE knock that also inflicts physical damage to anyone around 50 yards away from Chef Chewie.
  • ‍High Steaks
    • A channeled cast during which Chef Chewie spawns ground effects that deal physical damage and stuns players standing in them.
  • Required Magic Dispel:
    • ‍Erupting Inferno
      • Applies a Magic debuff to a random player, inflicting fire damage for 9 seconds.
        • Dispelling these whenever possible greatly reduces the overall damage taken by the group.
  • Required Enrage Dispel:
    • ‍Thirsty
      • After some time of engaging with the mob, it gains an Enrage buff that increases its attack and cast speed.
        • Soothing it greatly decreases the danger of the mob.
  • Required Kick:
    • ‍Boiling Flames
      • A channeled cast that fixates on a random player.
  • Required Bleed Dispel:
    • ‍Mean Mug
      • Applies a stacking Bleed debuff to a tank.
        • Consider dispelling those whenever your tank gains too many of the Bleed stacks.
  • Required Enrage Dispel:
    • ‍Thirsty
      • After some time of engaging with the mob, it gains an Enrage buff that increases its attack and cast speed.
        • Soothing it greatly decreases the danger of the mob.
  • ‍Volatile Keg
    • An aoe cast that inflicts fire dot to every member of your group.
  • ‍Throw Chair
    • A single target cast inflicting physical damage on a random player.
  • Required Enrage Dispel:
    • ‍Thirsty
      • After some time of engaging with the mob, it gains an Enrage buff that increases its attack and cast speed.
        • Soothing it greatly decreases the danger of the mob.
  • ‍Cinderbrew Toss
    • Spawns a ground effect that deals fire damage and disorients anyone standing in it.

Brew Master Aldryr

Patch 11.1 - Undermine(d)
Cinderbrew Meadery
‍Keg Smash
‍Blazing Belch
‍Throw Cinderbrew
‍Happy Hour
  • Brew Master Aldryr smashes his current target, inflicting physical damage and knocking them back.
    • Spawns few pools of
      ‍Hot Honey       during the knock. These pools persist for a long time, make sure to not spawn it in an awkward place where it can be an issue for you during the
      ‍Happy Hour       phase. Preferably do it on the sides of the room.
  • A big frontal cone inflicting fire damage.
    • Always try to be close to the boss to have an easier time dodging the
      ‍Blazing Belch      .
  • Fire DoT that is applied to 2 random players.
    • Spawns
      ‍Hot Honey       under afflicted players upon application.
    • Use a personal whenever you get hit by
      ‍Throw Cinderbrew      .
  • Whenever Brew Master Aldryr drops down to 66% and 33% health, the intermission phase starts.
  • During the phase boss takes almost no damage due to
    ‍Disregard     buff and players need to do a minigame by delivering Thirsty Patrons their cinderbrew.
    • Until being fed, Thirsty Patrons cast
      ‍Rowdy Yell       and do damage to the group while also reducing their haste.
    • To pick up the cinderbrew you need to click on a mug that's being placed on the bar. After that run towards the Thirsty Patrons and the mug will be delivered automatically once you are close to any of the patrons.
      • You can use any movement abilities available during delivering the mug to deal with the phase faster.
  1. Once you feed all the Thirsty Patrons, a few
    ‍Crawling Brawls     appear which are moving pools on the ground that you need to avoid.
    • Coming into contact with one will lead to suffering physical damage and getting stunned.

I'pa Trash Area

Patch 11.1 - Undermine(d)
Cinderbrew Meadery
Careless Hopgoblin
Taste Tester
Venture Co. Pyromaniac
Flavor Scientist
Brew Drop
  • ‍Reckless Delivery
    • Long channeled cast on a random player that will be targeted by Careless Hopgoblin to charge towards, inflicting physical damage and knocking players in its path.
      • Careless Hopgoblin is getting
        ‍Stunned         upon hitting the wall after the charge and spawns few Brew Drops.
      • Always try to aim him to the closest wall to avoid pulling any unnecessary packs.
  • Required Kick:
    • ‍Free Samples?
      • Casts at a random player and deals fire damage.
  • Required Enrage Dispel:
    • ‍Spill Drink
      • Grants an Enrage buff to a Taste Tester, increasing their damage done.
        • Soothe it whenever possible, especially if you know that
          ‍Free Samples?           is going to get through.
  • Required Magic Dispel:
    • ‍Erupting Inferno
      • Applies a Magic debuff to a random player, inflicting fire damage for 9 seconds.
        • Dispeling these whenever possible greatly reduces overall damage taken by the group.
  • Required Enrage Dispel:
    • ‍Thirsty
      • After some time of engaging with the mob, it gains an Enrage buff that increases its attack and cast speed.
        • Soothing it greatly decreases the danger of the mob.
  • Required Kick:
    • ‍Boiling Flames
      • A channeled cast that fixates on a random player.
  • Required Kick:
    • ‍Rejuvenating Honey
      • Applies a Magic buff to an ally that heals it over 18 seconds.
      • Purge it in case a kick was missed.
  • ‍Failed Batch
    • Summons a Failed Batch that starts a 10 second cast which inflicts AoE fire damage to all players upon succeeding.
      • Focus it immediately because letting it go through may easily lead to a wipe.
      • AoE spells do work on a Failed Batch so it can also be passively cleaved down if you have enough damage.
  • ‍Oozing Honey
    • Drops a pool on the ground that shrinks over time.

I'pa

Patch 11.1 - Undermine(d)
Cinderbrew Meadery
‍Spouting Stout
‍Bottoms Uppercut
‍Burning Fermentation
  • ‍Spouting Stout     is an 8 sec channeled cast that deals fire damage every 2 seconds and spawns fire pools on the ground, some of them also spawn Brew Drops.
    • Press a defensive for the
      ‍Spouting Stout       cast and cleave down Brew Drops efficiently without letting them reach the boss.
  • Brew Drops always move towards I'pa.
    • I'pa consumes any Brew Drop it touches, inflicting fire damage to all players and granting I'pa an absorb shield.
    • Brew Drops gain energy over time while they are alive, upon reaching 100 energy they increase their movement speed by 200%.
    • Spawns
      ‍Oozing Honey       on the ground upon death.
      • ‍Oozing Honey         shrinks over time and respawns the Brew Drop whenever the pool is fully dissolved.
  • Punches the current target, inflicting physical damage and knocking him back.
    • Because of
      ‍Fill 'Er Up      , the positioning of the boss is very important. As a tank be careful of where you are getting knocked to avoid consuming any Brew Drops.
  • Fire Magic DoT which is applied to 2 random players.
    • Help your healer with dispelling it if you can with spells like
      ‍Singe Magic      ,
      ‍Mass Dispel       or racials like
      ‍Stoneform      .
    • If you can't dispel a second dot, press a small defensive for it.

Benk Buzzbee Thrash Area

Patch 11.1 - Undermine(d)
Cinderbrew Meadery
Venture Co. Honey Harvester
Bee Wrangler
Royal Jelly Purveyor
Worker Bee
Bee-let
  • ‍Swarming Surprise
    • An AoE cast that inflicts physical damage to nearby players.
      • Applies a stacking debuff that increases damage taken from
        ‍Swarming Surprise        .
  • ‍Beeswax
    • Venture Co. Honey Harvester stuns any player around him and inflicts physical damage to them.
      • This is a Magic stun and can be dispelled.
  • Required Kick:
    • ‍Bee-stial Wrath
      • Enrages the caster and nearby bees, increasing their damage.
        • ‍Bee-stial Wrath           is an Enrage buff. Try to soothe it if you miss a kick.
  • ‍Shoot
    • Shoots the target, inflicting physical damage.
  • ‍Bee-Zooka
    • A long fixated cast on a random player that shoots a bee in a frontal line, inflicting fire damage and knocking anyone standing in the line.
      • Can be outranged to fully avoid getting hit and knocked by it.
  • Required Kick:
    • ‍Honey Volley
      • An AoE cast that deals nature damage and slows any player within 60 yards.
  • ‍Rain of Honey
    • Spawns pools on the ground which deals nature damage to targets within the impact.
  • Required Bleed Dispel:
    • ‍Shredding Sting
      • Applies a stacking Bleed debuff to a random player.
      • Dispel it whenever a player has multiple stacks of those.
  • ‍Final Sting
    • A long cast that inflicts fire damage upon succeeding on its target.
    • Worker Bee dies right after casting it.
    • Starts casting it once Worker Bee is below 28% of hp.
    • Deals pretty heavy damage on its target, make sure your tank is not taking too many of them at the same time.
  • Required Magic Dispel:
    • ‍Bee Venom
      • Applies a stacking Magic debuff to the tank that slows and inflicts nature damage.

Benk Buzzbee

Patch 11.1 - Undermine(d)
Cinderbrew Meadery
‍Snack Time
‍Honey Marinade
‍Fluttering Wing
  • Benk Buzzbee spawns 3 barrels that attract Ravenous Cinderbees.
    • Ravenous Cinderbees apply a
      ‍Shredding Sting       stacking Bleed to a random player. Be careful if you get multiple of those.
  • Once a Ravenous Cinderbee is killed it can be mounted and used to charge and destroy the barrels.
    • Simply mount one of them, aim towards the barrel and press the new ability on the bars.
    • Defeated Ravenous Cinderbee disappear once the new cast of
      ‍Snack Time       happens.
  • Benk Buzzbee applies a debuff on his target that inflicts damage to anyone within 6 yards of the target upon the expiration.
    • Leaves a pool on the ground that deals fire damage to players within it.
  • A 2 second channeled cast during which Benk Buzzbee pushes players away and inflicts nature damage to them.
    • Press a defensive and be careful to not get pushed back into
      ‍Honey Marinade       pools.

Goldie Baronbottom Thrash Area

Patch 11.1 - Undermine(d)
Cinderbrew Meadery
Yes Man
  • ‍Field Promotion
    • Increases the damage done and fully heals all nearby Yes Mans whenever a Yes Man dies. This effect stacks.
      • This makes AoE in this pack pointless, make sure to focus the same Yes Man together with the group one by one.
  • ‍Downward Trend
    • Yes Man leaps towards a random player, inflicting physical damage on impact to any player around him and causing them to Bleed.

Goldie Baronbottom

Patch 11.1 - Undermine(d)
Cinderbrew Meadery
‍Spread the Love!
‍Let It Hail!
‍Burning Ricochet
‍Cash Cannon
  • Goldie Baronbottom fills the room with multiple of Cinderbrew Bombs.
  • Cinderbrew Bombs detonate upon being struck by any of the other boss abilities.
    • Once detonated, each Bomb will erupt and send out waves of fire.
    • 4 of the Cinderbrew Bombs are going to be Volatile. Main difference of a Volatile Bomb is that it will apply a
      ‍Cindering Wound       stack to every player upon detonation.
  • Your strategy should revolve around never getting more than 2 stacks of
    ‍Cindering Wounds     at once. There are two ways to achieve that, you either:
    • Get first Volatile Bomb with the very first
      ‍Cash Cannon       of the phase and then one Volatile Bomb each time you get a
      ‍Burning Ricochet      .
    • Get every Volatile Bomb only with
      ‍Cash Cannon      .
      • Be careful as any
        ‍Cash Cannon         other than the very first one of the phase will overlap with
        ‍Burning Ricochet         timing so it will extend the duration of the
        ‍Cindering Wound         DoT.
  • Once
    ‍Let It Hail!     happens, all bombs are going to detonate together.
  • Upon reaching 100 energy detonates every Cinderbrew Bomb and deals fire damage every second for 5 seconds.
    • Always press a big defensive during this cast.
  • A fire DoT that is applied to 2 random players.
    • Upon application it can ricochet to other players or a Cinderbrew Bomb.
      • Cinderbrew Bombs will detonate if they are being cleaved with
        ‍Burning Ricochet        .
    • If you are not detonating a Volatile Bomb then try to hit at least a few normal Cinderbrew Bombs to make dodging easier later on during the
      ‍Let It Hail!       cast.
  • A tank frontal cone that inflicts physical damage and knocks any player struck.
    • Any Cinderbrew Bomb hit by it erupts.
    • Never hit a Volatile Bomb with it if you already have a stack of
      ‍Cindering Wounds       active.

Dungeon Extras + Specials

Patch 11.1 - Undermine(d)
Cinderbrew Meadery

Cinderbrew Meadery dungeon has 2 special items that can be used by certain professions or races.

Cooking Pot

  • Requires at least 25 skill in Alchemy or Cooking.
  • Can be used once over the next 3 minutes.
  • ‍Sticky Honey     - throws a glob of sticky honey at a location, splashing up to 8 targets including players, reducing their haste and movement speed for 9 seconds.
  • Not very impactful but still can be utilized in a small pull to reduce the danger of the pack. Make sure to not hit your teammates with it as it also goes on players too.

Flamethrower

  • Requires to be a
    ‍Gnome    ,
    ‍Goblin    ,
    ‍Mechagnome     or to have at least 25 skill in Engineering.
  • Can be used once over the next minute.
  • ‍Flame On!     - strikes enemies in front of the caster inflicting 1% of their maximum health every second over the next 4 seconds and disorienting them for 5 seconds.
  • Disorient in this case is a hard cc, making it an AoE stun.
  • Very useful and should be used on the hardest pack in the relevant area.

Lootpool
